titleStmt.title: J. Q. A. Foster et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG9246

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: We the undersigned Citizens of Campbell Co Ky would respectfully represent that Jno F Hase of this county was at the present term of the Campbell Circuit Court tried and Convicted of keeping a tippling house more then one year Ago and fined Sixty Dollars and is now Confined in the Jail of this County, that he is an exceedingly poor Man & industrious Man and a good citizen & has a wife who is partially in insane and has been confined in the Lunatic asylum hertofore, that he has five small helpless Children who depend wholly upon his daily Earnings for their support.
We deem it a Case truly deserving Your Excellencys' Clemency & Pray that You remit his fine at once

J. Q A Foster
L M Eckert
F. A. Boyd
R Maddox
Thos D Snyder
Jesse Merrany
James H Parker
C W Kavanaugh
James R, Hallam
Geo Artman
H D Helm
John H Nelson
Tho. M, Winston
W. C. Arthur -- Atty for Com'th
Ira Root
F, M Webster.
R T. Baker
E. W. Hawkins
Wm Stricker
Owen Carlan
Geo R Fearons
John
Theo Chamberlin
J John H Barlow
Moses Cook
Thos Dixon

Campbell Cir Ct
Remitted --
B. M.
